zone.line: And lies he only still ever in the grass
In that dirt buries he his nose
The Lord
Hast thou to me further nothing to say?
Comest thou only always to critisise
Is on the Earth ever to thee nothing right?
Mephistopheles
No Lord! I find it there as ever, very bad.
Men to regret me in thier miserable days
I makey so much the wretched themselves not to plague
The Lord
Knowest thou Faust?
Mephistopheles
The Doctor?
The Lord
My slave
Mephistopheles
Certainly! he serves you according to his peculiar knowledge
Nothing earthly is the fool's drink nor food
Him drives fermentation into the distance
He is thus of himself madness half known;
Of the heaven demands he the most brilliant stars
